title: Veterinary Diagnosis: Cardiac Auscultation
hint: A common cardiac abnormality detected during physical examination

clues.text: Primary diagnostic tool used in physical examination
clues.explanation: The stethoscope is the essential tool for cardiac auscultation, allowing veterinarians to hear heart sounds and detect abnormalities.

clues.text: Abnormal whooshing or swishing sound heard between normal heart beats
clues.explanation: Heart murmurs are abnormal sounds caused by turbulent blood flow through the heart, heard as a whoosh between the normal 'lub-dub' sounds.

clues.text: Graded on a scale from 1 to 6 based on loudness
clues.explanation: Murmurs are graded I/VI (barely audible) to VI/VI (can be heard without stethoscope touching chest), helping assess severity.

clues.text: Can be caused by leaky heart valves or abnormal blood flow
clues.explanation: Murmurs result from valvular insufficiency (leaky valves), stenosis (narrowed valves), or structural heart defects causing turbulent flow.

clues.text: Most commonly detected in older small breed dogs
clues.explanation: Mitral valve disease causing murmurs is extremely common in aging small breeds like Cavalier King Charles Spaniels, Chihuahuas, and Poodles.

clues.text: Requires echocardiogram to identify underlying cause and severity
clues.explanation: Cardiac ultrasound (echocardiography) visualizes heart structure and function, definitively identifying the cause of the murmur and guiding treatment.
